page.title: 16GRAVESEND TO TILBURY FERRY
page.content: The site of the {GRAVESEND TO TILBURY {FERRY}is one of the oldest in South-East England. Now owned by British Rail and Sealink, the ferry crosses the river Thames,linking{Kent} with Essex. The service was once owned by the{Southern Railway Company}and the company's initals can be seen on a bench at the end of the jetty.The service is good, with over 40 crossings every weekday. It is, however expensive a return ticket costing Â£2.00 for the short crossing.The ferry is used by people who work on either side of the Thames,with the earliest leaving Gravesend at 05.45. Though the buldings are in poor condition and it is badly signposted , the ferry provides an important link with people on the other side of the river.
